poem:
**Usha's Reflection**

In the glare of chosen paths,  
whispers swirl—  
Cambridge thoughts  
in campaign shadows.  
A smile strung tight,  
poised on edges  
of doubt and belonging,  
seeking the true face  
amidst shifting winds.  
Here, in the clatter,  
a quiet quest—  
who am I,  
and who to become?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Usha Vance hasn't fully Maga-fied herself yet. Is she having moments of doubt? | Arwa Mahdawi Usha Vance is a very clever woman with terrible taste in men. The Yale and Cambridge-educated lawyer quit her job at a prestigious DC firm the same day her husband was picked to be Donald Trump’s running mate. She trailed after him on the campaign trail, smiling for the cameras. A former Democrat, she aligned herself with Trump, a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
